website_summaries.verdict: A workhorse humidifier designed to create thousands of square feet of humidified air. Great for whole-home treatment.
pros: Creates significant humidity for multiple rooms
cons: Fan motor can be loud on highest setting
Refilling tanks can be a challenge
Mold and bacteria growth possible without antimicrobial agent

customer_reviews.title: Works overtime but barely makes a dent in humidity
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier has a small water capacity compared to other Honeywell humidifiers. I have a small apt (780 sf) and this unit has to run 24x7 with at least twice a day resevoir refills to just get it to register 38% humidity. You'll be much better off with this Honeywell product  I had this one for 3 yrs and loved it. Only had to fill once per day for a 1400sf apt. And humidiy registered around 50%
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: We have had a Holmes humidifier for years and it finally died last year as it sprung a leak. I did not see anything similar from Holmes as I think Sunbeam changed to the Honeywell brand for the home humidifier like this one. Set up was easy had to do a little assembly. Turned it on in the afternoon by the morning the unit was dead. We attempted to contact the company for warranty but they never contacted us back. Looks like I am going to have to check out another brand. Kind of sad that this did not work out
customer_reviews.author: T. Bueschel

customer_reviews.title: Humidity Producing Champ if you can handle the noise
customer_reviews.text: This unit ramped up the humidity level in my large home from 27% to 47% in less than 2 days. An impressive performer to say the least. I set the fan to the highest setting and the unit registered 80 dB. I crave a quiet home and this level of noise was very annoying. Even the lower fan settings produced mid 60 dB levels. If you crave humid air and the noise doesn't bother you this is a really good machine. I ended up sending it back due to the noise. I already miss the comfort this device produced during its short stay. But I am enjoying a quiet home.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaked water all over the floor
customer_reviews.text: Used for 2 weeks and it leaked an entire tank of water on the floor twice. I have no idea why, but on 2 different occasions we suddenly heard what sounded like water running. It turned out to be the left water tank leaking both times. Unfortunately, it dumped nearly the whole tank before we caught it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cheatham

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST THING I'VE EVER PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: Leaked everywhere. I now have damage to my ceiling. I bought this, because I had a similar Honeywell. It was still going strong (WITH NO ISSUES) after 5 years, but I moved and gave it away. I should have read the reviews. Numerous reviews stated leaking issues. TThe float valves are a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fairly quiet, one tank sometimes won't feed, not adequate for 1800 foot area
customer_reviews.text: The unit is fairly quiet. One of the tanks generally has to be joggled to begin feeding. Our house has electric heat, so lack of humidity is a problem. I am trying to humidify the main living area, maybe 1800 square feet. We live in Northern Minnesota, and the frigid air is really dry. This unit might work well in friendlier climates, but in our area it just doesn't have the capacity to get the humidity above 20%. Better than nothing, but if I had it to do over again I wouldn't buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Unit is quite, two large water reservoirs that are easy to fill and pretty much last 24 hours. It stopped running after 6 weeks. I contacted customer support and they will send me a new one under warranty at no cost. My only complaint is it will take up to 4 weeks from the time they get my old one back, before I get a replacement. So I'm looking at possibly 5+ weeks without a humidifer, in the middle of winter.
customer_reviews.author: The Drifter

customer_reviews.title: This humidifier has worked well for my space
customer_reviews.text: I like the appearance, the quietness and the humidifying ability ....works well for my space...though I was experiencing some issues with water leaking....my initial leaking event was remedied by making sure the filter was fully saturated ....that was the ticket....no more leaking....just make sure you fully saturate your filter before using.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Schafer

customer_reviews.title: So far has worked just fine
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a couple days but since I started using it, the humidity % in the house has stayed at 50%, and very steady. Was nervous buying a humidifier in general because of so many negative reviews, but if this keeps working as it is now I see no problems with it. Straight forward, easy to put together, and my hygrometer keeps a very consistent reading at 50%, which is where I want it since I have a piano. I really like that it holds 3 gallons of water, which was the main reason I chose this one over the smaller ones. Also like that it doesn't put out a mist - no powdery film on things.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Decent humidifier with some leak issues
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because it replaced the older version that we’d had for years that broke. It works as expected with a few leaks. Sometimes for no reason we can tell, the tanks leak/float out of the tray and water gets everywhere. We haven’t figured out what happens when that happens, but it only happens occasionally. The motor isn’t overly loud, but it isn’t quiet either. The output is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: good humidifier but difficult to refill and clean
customer_reviews.text: This humidifer does a great job at its core job of humidifying. However, refilling the tanks is extremely difficult and frustrating -- they inexplicably have no handles or ridges, making them extremely difficult to 1) hold under water, 2) carry to and from the unit, and 3) replace into their narrow sockets. Cleaning the device (two tanks and one tray, all with crevices and nooks) is also very difficult and time-consuming. The frustration level is high enough that I am not sure that I would purchase this humidifier again, despite its excellent performance.
customer_reviews.author: a_guy_in_boston

customer_reviews.title: Defects
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work correctly. At first the humidity gauge was not functioning and the unit would not run continuously for me. Now I can’t even get it to turn on at all. Will be returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns itself off prematurely
customer_reviews.text: I'm having some problems with this model. It interrupts its cycle with one of the two tanks still full of water, and it does this on a regular basis. What some others have said, i.e. that the construction and material seem cheaper than the previous model, matches my impressions. This unit must have cost significantly less to produce, or production costs went way up. Either way, this does not feel solid, easily spills, won't complete a cycle reliably. Otherwise, it's fine: when operating, it humidifies the room nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sanday

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: This thing leaks water all the time. Perhaps it has to be perfectly level. I prefer my Lasko even though it is noiser.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great functioning. Humidifies two large rooms open to each other without a problem. I bought a humidity gauge to check the humidity setting and it stayed within a 3 percentage point range. It is very easy to fill from the top, doesn’t leak, and very easy to change the filter. No mineral dust that is produced by ultrasonic humidifiers. The Honeywell brand filter replacement filters with anti-microbial factors keep the humidity clean and I don’t have a mold allergy reaction. I am very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: stur

customer_reviews.title: very powerful at moisturizing the air!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up - I had the humidifier on high all night and the next morning, my carpeting throughout the upstairs was damp. Do not keep on HIGH setting. 1/4/2020 - Humidifier all of a sudden starting streaming water out - it was enough water that I could hear it running out from the opposite side of the room. It had been working GREAT up until then....The containers were securely in place. Had been filled a few hours earlier and working fine prior to that...
customer_reviews.author: Audrey L Kangas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this model
customer_reviews.text: Like others here I’ve had the problem of only one tank emptying. I saved the wheels from my old Honeywell which fit this unit perfectly but I had to put shims to get this exactly level. Occasionally this unit would use both tanks but it more frequently would use only one and sometimes the base would overflow and flood the floor if I tried to get a full tank to drain with a little jiggle. My old Honeywell HCM 6009 was “set it and forget” simple so I returned this aggravating model and bought the old, proven design. Don’t waste your time with this “improved” humidifier design.
customer_reviews.author: Gatz

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell top fill humidifier
customer_reviews.text: After figuring out how the machine uses water from one tank, then the other (as opposed to simultaneously drawing water from both tanks), this machine is great. Working reliably, and putting humidity into the air. The control work well and are intuitive. As the house does not have a water softener, the only "drawback" to this humidifier is that -- to keep the cost of replacement filters down -- I'm buying RO water from a local health food store, which is pretty inexpensive, but a hassle to haul. Overall, a well built machine that's doing the intended job.
customer_reviews.author: GMN

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old Honeywell humidifier motor finally died so I wanted to replace it with the same or similar model and this was closest available. The first one received only ran for about 20 minutes with the humidity level turned up to the highest point and then stopped for about 20 minutes. It would start up again and run for another 15 or 20 minutes and then stop again. I called Honeywell and was told that the humidifier must be defective so I was sent a replacement. The replacement did the same thing. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Aloysius

customer_reviews.title: Seems to keeps humidity at a good level.
customer_reviews.text: This replaces an ultrasonic humidifier. For the month or so we have used it we do not see any white dust buildup that we saw with the other humidifier. Only drawbacks is the fact that this required a filtering that needs to be changed periodically. If we don’t get the white dust, then maybe that’s a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Weeden

customer_reviews.title: Significant upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I loved the old model, and used it for 10 years. The biggest problem was filling the tanks, and this new unit has solved that problem. It has a good capacity, is relatively quiet, and makes a huge difference in my house. I use a digital hygrometer in another room to fine-tune the settings. It is easy to find swivel wheels on Amazon for this unit, or take them from your old unit if you have one.
customer_reviews.author: Bro. Dan

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: Has to return.. kept spilling over the tray underneath and soaking the floor. Reinstalled the floats numerous times to no avail. Bought to replace Honeywell tower that we loved.. they quit making it.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Easy Fillup
customer_reviews.text: It has been necessary for me to run a humidifier for the last 35 years and I have worn out several brands. The Honeywell works quite well and is doing the job. The top fill on the unit is a great feature. Using a watering can to fill the tanks is a big plus and not having to remove the tanks from the machine simplifies things. It has kept the humidity at the desired level and runs fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product functions great and is designed well.
customer_reviews.text: The humidifier works excellent as it should and adequately humidifies a relatively large area. Top-fill capability assists with easy refilling; however, refilling the humidifier by taking the tanks out requires a bit of care when re-seating them properly back on to the main unit. The fan is a bit noisy even on the low setting, but not so noisy as to detract from holding a conversation, listening to the tv, etc.
customer_reviews.author: st

customer_reviews.title: Better than previous models
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the negative reviews. I bought the grandfather of this machine in the 90’s. So what if the tanks take an extra second to put in or it doesn’t come with wheels? Of course the water tanks will break if you drop one when it’s full. It works well and humidifies the room.
customer_reviews.author: sklaw5

customer_reviews.title: Very simple design and works!
customer_reviews.text: We have a high desert vacation home of about 1,700 sq. feet. This unit puts plenty of moisture into our dry air. I also purchased a monitor to see where our levels were. We started at 21% RH and which showed low on the monitor and moved to 31% RH which then showed OK within 12 hours so to me that was quick. Easy to assemble and fill the water tanks. Works as prescribed one tank empties then the next one goes. We keep ours on low fan which is hardly audible. We keep the moisture setting on full since our air is so dry. Highly recommended so far!
customer_reviews.author: Supertracks

customer_reviews.title: It's a Honey!
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier works very well. It has been keeping the humidity above 50% on the main floor as well as the upstairs. My cats don't even spark when you pet them anymore! Being able to fill it by the top rather than having to remove the containers is also a huge plus. If your home is dry, this Honeywell is a very good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: No musty or crusty plants over here.
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier is easy to set up and lasts a lot longer before I have to refill it. I like the fact that with the wicking filter I don’t have to worry about mineral build up on the items around my plants. I also like that it provides air circulation for them as well. That’s always a good thing, no musty or crusty plants.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren F

customer_reviews.title: Sub par humidifier
customer_reviews.text: Assembled correctly, but it leaks water everywhere. The auto feature stopped working after having for less than 24 hours. It doesn’t help everyone with colds. A sad purchase. It was supposed to be new.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement Over Previous Version
customer_reviews.text: I have not experienced any of the negative issues contained in other reviews. Big improvment over the previous version. I use protec humidifier cartridges to eliminate mold issues.
customer_reviews.author: GMS

customer_reviews.title: Broken from the start
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken, warranty process and shipping was around 2 weeks long Update after the warranty process was complete my new humidifier is excellent, i would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Mike Strcikland

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: Large capacity tanks (about 1.5 gal. each). I run it on high and the fan is quiet. No problem sleeping with it just 7 feet away. I do wish Honeywell didn't price gouge consumers on the replacement filters. After running for several hours, the humidity reaches 50%, which is where I want it. On high, I get about 10-11 hours run time on each tank. And so easy to fill!
customer_reviews.author: pattyb

customer_reviews.title: Leaked within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: One of the tanks would not shut off (plunger would not close) resulting in flooding of the hallway. Honeywell will replace, but it seems that will take most of the dry winter season. Not worth the hassle. Had to buy another humidifier to get through the season.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Two separate units failed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill, but electronics are very problematic. I had the first one replaced under warranty because the "humidity reached" light failed after a few days. It took two weeks to get the replacement, but then not only did that light also fail after a couple of weeks, but the humidistat doesn't work as described. Turning the humidity control knob all the way clockwise does not make the unit run constantly, as described in the user manual. It still cycles on and off, so the highest setting must be about 43%, because that's as high as this humidifier can get our living room. I'll replace it next season with a Holmes or Aircare.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonOldTimer

customer_reviews.title: So easy a cave man can do it.
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in, fill with water, set fan to low speed and set Humidity knob to about 3/4. Let it do it's job checking water level every 12 hours, add as needed. UPDATE : occasionally or when refilling tanks, I recommend turning the filter/wick upside down. It seems to work more efficiently by keeping the entire filter/wick wet.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Orpin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Whole House Humidifier
customer_reviews.text: We live in a very dry climate and needed a humidifier that will do the whole house. This one finally does it! It goes through 2 to 3 gallons of water a day. We fill it twice a day and turn over the wick. Once a week we clean it. Yes, it is a little effort running it, but it works so wonderful. We love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: JERRY D.

customer_reviews.title: Humidifier output
customer_reviews.text: Output of about 3 gals per 24n hrs. is good - level holding between 43 & 50 in1700 sq. ft. single storyhome. Filter holding up OK for 1st month using softner water. No sign of water leakage - using top fill feature with 1 gal. water jug. Only have to clean about every 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wisniewski

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good evaporative humidifier. Not a super great capacity but okay. A bit of pain to clean but they all are. There is no humidity indicator so you'll need to have a humidity meter somewhere. Overall a good balance between capacity, performance, and maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Eng I. Neer

customer_reviews.title: exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this as a large bedroom humidifier for the last 9 months and this thing is built tough. Not one mechanical issue. There's no wet mist with the evaporative technology so your floor isn't wet or slippery. I bought this for the dry Las Vegas nights cause I was waking up feeling crusty and congested and this humidifier has made a big difference. I highly recommend this make and model by Honeywell. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Strope

customer_reviews.title: Works reliably... most of the time
customer_reviews.text: For the most part it works fine, but does fairly regularly run down one tank and then stop without switching over to the other one. Slight tap or wiggle will trigger the release mechanism and it continues. And yes, it is sitting on a level floor.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuru

customer_reviews.title: If nothing else, you should know this.
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. Only issue is putting water tanks back - trying to align them takes a bit of effort. It's easier to fill them where they are using a pitcher or whatever you have.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen D

customer_reviews.title: Works but smaller that the discontinued older model & poor design
customer_reviews.text: I had previously given this a 4 star review but after using this during the winter I am changing it to 1 star. Poor design. Small valves off the water tanks did not seal properly & unit overflowed. Happened twice & I made sure the tanks were properly seated. Go back to the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but controls and fan need update
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with the capacity and ability of the humidifier, it works well. However, the two-knob design for fan speed and humidity level is 1980’s technology- incorporating a single digital control for desired humidity level like the Levoit would be a big improvement. The fan blade design also needs to be improved to reduce the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best humidifier I've ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last fall and it was the best Minnesota winter yet! Works very well and is extremely well made. Much better than all the previous humidifiers that I have purchased over the years. Easy to fill and clean and is just more pleasing all around. I am very happy with it and would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: ShannaBirmingham

customer_reviews.title: Puts out a lot of water
customer_reviews.text: This unit puts out a lot of water without the mineral dust deposited on everything from the ultrasonic humidifiers. The loading of water in the top is a big plus; the containers don't have to be lifted, filled, and replaced. It puts out a couple of gallons of moisture a day and brings the humidity up to about 40%; a very comfortable level.
customer_reviews.author: GiddyCal

customer_reviews.title: This one WILL work creating lots of moist air!
customer_reviews.text: Recently replaced a competitor’s device with this - and it works as advertised! Definitely will put lots of moisture into the air. It’s been running about 8-hours now and has already ‘processed’ one full tank of water. Yes, this unit will put 4-gallons or more into the air within 24-hours.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Pietrzak

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Its not as noisy as some models, however the tanks sometimes leakout completely flooding the floor and other times it doesn't recognize a full tank is seated and I have to lift it up & reset it do the water releases from the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Have been using three weeks now I have had no overflow, issues , the tanks seem to drain evenly. I like the lid where I can constantly top it off and the handle is secure and stout. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This unit was easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit for my aged parents. We are using it in the second season. It worked well and was easy for my father to fill with a water picture. Purchase extra filters up front, the original filter did not last long, I am waiting to see how the replacement filter lasts. It looks to be much better quality. Only problem was one float stopped floating and the unit over flowed and ruined the finish on a 50 year old stereo cabinet. I should have set it on something more disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Beard II

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a broken Sears (Essick/Aircare) unit. Much quieter. My house was at about 30% RH. Put about 4 gallons into the air and brought RH up to about 45% in a day or so. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: John Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Humidistat didn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these larger humidifiers. They were easy to assemble and set-up. One worked perfectly, out-of-the-box. The other had a defective humidity control and only worked intermittently despite the humidistat being set on "constant run." Currently waiting for manufacturer to fix / replace the defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to assemble. The feature I like the best is the ability to fill the tanks right on the machine if desired. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rita K.

customer_reviews.title: NOISY AND SMELLS BAD
customer_reviews.text: The dehumidifier hums loudly when the fan turns on. Not sure if it is the case due to fan vibration or the motor. The pad also causes the air coming out to smell bad. I tried rinsing it out and got most of the smell out (chemical?), but after 12 hours, the smell is back. I'll try rinsing it out again, but don't have much hope.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: ⭐⭐⭐⭐1/2 (Yes, That's Four-And-A-Half Stars) ... Practically Perfect Honeywell Cool-Mist Humidifier
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this Honeywell high-capacity cool-mist humidifier except that even if you want it to keep running, it's designed to cycle on and off based on what it determines to be "enough" humidity. Even so, it's an excellent product that's very well made, a breeze to use, and does a beautiful job of humidifying and cooling the air.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: What a difference this has made.
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this humidifier for about a month and so far we love it. It has made a huge difference in my eczema and we are not getting shocked every time we turn on a light or touch each other. The filter is starting to crust up but we are on well water so the filter may not last as long as with city water. Gave it 4 stars only because we have had it for only a month.
customer_reviews.author: V C Bolan

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for overdue Hunter brand that was due for replacement
customer_reviews.text: Though I could use a larger one for my small Ranch Home, this is still ideal to do what I want it to do for replacement one. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jg1

customer_reviews.title: Much Better for Me than the Previous Version
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a couple of the previous Honeywell versions of this humidifier. By far, this one is the easest to fill. Of course, it humidifies very well.
customer_reviews.author: Hagen LeBray

customer_reviews.title: FOR US~THIS IS A SUPERB PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a smaller home, and find that by strategically placing this Humidifier that it will keep our Home Warm, and Cozy. THANK YOU HONEYWELL!
customer_reviews.author: SgtPepper

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Works good I use it to humidify a 1300 sq ft space
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W

customer_reviews.title: Could be 5 star, but can only give 3.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great when it's working. First one I ordered, it stopped working after 2 months. I returned it and received new one. I received the new unit about a month and so far no problems. I'll follow up if there are any further issues
customer_reviews.author: baller91762

customer_reviews.title: Leaked within a month
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier began to leak/overflow about a month after placing in service overflowing onto my wooden floor. I am going to attempt to get warranty support from Honeywell but don't see any obvious way to get direct support on thier website. Be cautious with this and put it in a pan or something that will trap water if you don't want to risk damage to your home.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: First rate humidifier.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit a few months ago and it has performed flawlessly. I love the twin tanks that you can easily fill from the top. The filter is easy to access.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: More often than is acceptable one or both of the ranks won’t drain into reservoir. Needs to be tapped.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Totally surprised with the features.
customer_reviews.text: Dual tanks are great good size for a 72 yr. old to lift. Easy to refill and replace. Smart tech. to shut down when water is low that helps keep the filter moist.
customer_reviews.author: JC47

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered in a timely matter. it is easy to setup. It has worked well to keep the humidity up to 50% in my mothers house. it will rum on low speed for around 24hrs and it does 2 good size rooms, her dinning 7 living rooms.
customer_reviews.author: John F Begely

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to fill.
customer_reviews.text: I really like how easy it is to fill the tanks.
customer_reviews.author: TimmyO

customer_reviews.title: How good it works
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Its quiet and is like all humidifiers has to be filled every day but this one really put the moisture in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: floods  your floor
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 days. Top filled the tank on day three and the tank drained and flooded my hard wood floor. After mopping up the mess and drying the floor I took sledge hammer to break it into pieces. Did not want to return it since the vendor may resell to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Petit lady

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: It keeps my two bedroom apartment comfortable even when furnace is running often. Very efficient. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot smaller than I thought it would be. It works for my townhome but I almost need two rather than one.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia L. DeNike

customer_reviews.title: So far I am pleased
customer_reviews.text: Runs a lot in my pellet stove heated home. Helps with dryness.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jones

customer_reviews.title: A very nice unit.
customer_reviews.text: This model can be filled from the top which makes it easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Balliet

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. Looks good. Easy to set up and use. Much quieter than my previous Honeywell humidifier. Filters are a bit pricy.
customer_reviews.author: O. Bisogno Scotti

customer_reviews.title: It works. Gives you lots of moisture w/o frizzy natural curly  hair.
customer_reviews.text: When I put in a fresh filter I have to add water sometimes twice a day but we were warned when we moved here that it was a very dry atmosphere so I know my little machine is working hard. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My house is quite dry in the winter so needs to be filled about once a day. Removable tanks make it easy.
customer_reviews.author: caregiver

customer_reviews.title: overflowed for no reason
customer_reviews.text: Works great but one time it overflowed for no reason ...
customer_reviews.author: Go Bernie!

customer_reviews.title: Very good humidifier for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Humidifier is easy to fill. Very quiet on low and medium settings. Filter is easy to change. Easily keeps our 300 square foot bedroom at 40 t0 45 percent humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great humidifier! It’s very easy to use and to fill up with water. It’s not loud-especially on low/medium.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Yost

customer_reviews.title: Works grear
customer_reviews.text: Works great and covers a large portion of the house.
customer_reviews.author: christiesreview

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to refill and very durable. Be ready to spend a penny on filters though.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Received as expected and set up was easy. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D Gill Jr

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works really well. I’m happy with it and would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to keep filter clean
customer_reviews.text: Very big and awkward, filter very difficult to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent O.

customer_reviews.title: STILL HAVENT RECEIVED CREDIT!
customer_reviews.text: Returned this back in Dec 2019 - it's now mid March 2020!
customer_reviews.author: LAURA BAJKOWSKI

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first.. had for 6 months and quit working
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Simons

customer_reviews.title: Runs like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome...quickly changed the moisture in the room from 17% to 40%.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: THE DEVICE WORKS WELL, WHEN IT WORKS. IT IS DESIGNED SIMILAR TO A TYPICAL TOILET TANK FLOAT BALL, WHICH SHUTS OFF WATER WHEN TANK FILLS. hOWEVER, THE DESIGN ON THIS DEVICE REVERSES THAT CONCEPT AND ALLOWS WATER TO FLOW WHEN RESERVOIR AT BASE EMPTIES. THE PROBLEM IS THE DEVICE MUST BE ABSOLUTELY LEVEL OR THE FLOW FLOATS DON'T OPEN THE TANKS TO REFILL THE RESERVOIR. EVEN WITH THE DEVICE LEVEL, I STILL HAVE TO TAP THE TANKS ONCE IN AWHILE TO LOOSEN FLOAT & ALLOW REFILL. I DO NOT RECOMMEND PURCHASING THIS ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: DocK

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than the old model
customer_reviews.text: I had the old 6009 for years before the fan motor began making noise, so I got this one. Uses the same filter. Air blows out top instead of sides. It didn't have wheels, but has holes on bottom for standard casters: 2" Replacement office task chair caster wheels w/ 7/16" x 7/8" grip ring mounting stem. 2" is the diameter of the wheel. 7/16" is the width of the shaft fitting into the hole, 7/8" is the length of the shaft. The unit can take well over an inch for the length of the shaft if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: UpRider

customer_reviews.title: No white dust and top fill tanks!
customer_reviews.text: I have very hard water and keeping the humidity up for my piano has been a challenge. This type of humidifier does not have the white dust that other types do which is a definite plus. I have to change the filters often (3 weeks), but that's not a problem. The best thing is that you can fill up the tanks from the top of the tanks. The only negative I have is sometimes a full tank doesn't empty because the float doesn't activitate properly; I end up having to reseat the tank after I notice the humidity dive much sooner than anticipated. Overall I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: V. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Unit seems of quality but has issues.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking unit but far from happy with it. Water jugs are easy to fill but sometimes hard to place back on unit. looks like you have them in place when returning after filling but sometimes they don't just drop into place. Even though this is new, it does not always empty all the water. Unit will shut down with one side still half full. Yes its clean, floats are free etc. Not a lack of care on my part. Must say when it operates properly, it does a great job and is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Alber Excavating Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Ruined our Wood Floors
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this humidifier for approximately 1.5 months and first it would quit running because it said low water, but one of the tanks would be completely full and then it leaked all over our wood floors and before we noticed (it started leaking from the bottom) the water had soaked into our wood floors and now our floors are buckled. VERY FRUSTRATING!!!
customer_reviews.author: rmthree

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased at least one dozen humidifiers over the past few years and this is the first non-ultrasonic that actually works. While the ultrasonics worked, the white dust is ridiculous and even invades the inside contents of cabinets. I can only imagine what they do to electronics. I use Essick Air Humidifier treatment in the tanks and haven’t had any mold on the filter and virtually no mineral buildup in the bottom of the unit. This is my second winter season with the humidifier and I haven’t had any issues. I highly recommend this Honeywell.
customer_reviews.author: vt

customer_reviews.title: Good Humidifier
customer_reviews.text: After trying two other humidifiers we found this one works well. The tanks are easy to fill and the optional accessories provide us with the features we need. We no longer have to be concerned with bacteria build-up in the machine or white powder over everything. The tanks are easy to fill. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is that it is noisy if you run it on any other setting than ‘Low’. However, once the room reaches the humidity level you need, it can be left on Low which is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: chai lover

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this humidifier!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Honeywell truly over thought this one. It adds "float" devices that are totally unnecessary and trigger water leaks. Buy a simple device. This was a disaster made worse by glitches with the return!
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Lil

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied customer: Difficult to fill, spills all over, tops of tanks overflow
customer_reviews.text: This product is not very good because you have to fill humidifiers frequently and this humidifier has two tanks which overflow when you carry them loaded with water. If you choose instead to fill them while they are on the humidifier, their narrow tops make a refill difficult and you get water all over the floor. Their size means you need a large container to carry to the humidifier, preferably a large container with a spout. Badly designed. The previous version which is no longer available had tanks with screw tops which meant they did not overflow when carried. I am considering returning this humidifier though that won't be an easy thing to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: Top Fill Moisture
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier is much larger than I expected. It’s terrific, though. Outputs a good amount of moisture, is the right amount of white noise, and is VERY easy to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I purposely bought one that was rated for a bigger house than mine, but not outrageously so. We have about 900 sq. ft., and it keeps it at 35-45 % humidity. It does need filled twie daily, but that is not a big issue since the tank come off and go on very easily, even when full (and we are older, with arthritic hands). Feel like is was a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier is a workhorse. I live in the desert, and as you can imagine it is super dry here. I have two of these humidifiers running in my house. My house is 1600 sq. ft. They keep the humidity between 50-60%. I have it set to the highest setting. It’s easy to maintain also.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: does a great job
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier does a good job of adding moisture to the air in the winter. I use the Honeywell replacement cartridges Filter HC14 Series E which last approximately 30 days, and I also use a water additive to prevent mold.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

customer_reviews.title: Humidity
customer_reviews.text: Used a Honeywell humidifier model 6009 for 10 years or so. The water tanks finally developed leaks at the joints. Replaced it with the Honeywell HEV685W top fill console humidifier. Chose this model because of the top fill feature which very convenient. I use a large plastic pitcher to fill the tanks. Have had it for two months. Replaced the origional filter once in that time.
customer_reviews.author: The Dean

product_meta.title: Honeywell HEV685W Top Fill Console Humidifier, White
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteCreate soothing, invisible moisture and get dry air relief for multiple rooms in your home with the Honeywell Top Fill Cool Moisture Console Humidifier. Designed for high moisture output, this large humidifier has two 1.5-gallon tanks and can run up to 24 hours on the low setting. The two removable top-fill water tanks each have a large opening and can be filled easily at the sink or with a pitcher. The translucent tanks allow for viewing water level and the flat bottom and feet allow the tank to stand independently. This advanced humidifier has an adjustable humidistat with high, medium, and low speed settings, and it automatically turns on and off to maintain your desired humidity level. The humidifier also shuts off automatically when the tanks are empty and has a refill light that signals when the tanks need to be filled. This Honeywell cool moisture humidifier includes a wicking filter that removes minerals from water, reducing white dust in hard water areas and providing clean moisture output. The filter is treated with Protec antimicrobial to inhibit up to 99.99 percent of mold growth. To ensure optimal product performance, use only genuine Honeywell Replacement Wicking Filter Model HC-14 (Filter E), which inhibits up to 99.99% of mold growth on the filter.
feature_bullets: MULTI-ROOM COOL MIST HUMIDIFIER: If you need a humidifier for large rooms, or want to add moisture to your whole house, this 3 gallon, easy fill humidifier console with a humidistat can be combined with other options to help control humidity in your home.

HONEYWELL FILTERS: Genuine Honeywell replacement wicking filters use a patented antimicrobial that helps inhibit the growth & migration of mold, algae & bacterial on the filter. Use these filters, designed to fit Honeywell humidifiers, for best results.

HONEYWELL HUMIDIFIERS: Humidity levels in your home between 40-60% can make the air feel warmer & improve your breathing comfort, sleeping, nasal congestion & dry skin. Dry air can cause static electricity, damage wooden furniture & irritate health issues.

CONTROL YOUR HOME'S CLIMATE: Filter out dust and allergens with Honeywell air purifiers and filters for cleaner air, add humidity to the air to improve your comfort with Honeywell humidifiers, or help control air flow and circulation with Honeywell fans.

HONEYWELL QUALITY: Improve humidity levels in your home & improve your comfort with a Honeywell humidifier. Compare to humidifiers & similar products from Vicks, Crane, Urpower, Holmes, Boveda, Dyson, Evapolar, Aprilaire, Frigidaire, & Pure Guardian.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars348 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
